gurmukhi: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਖਸ਼ਟਮ ਗੁਰ ਮੰਗਲਾ ਚਰਣ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Kari Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Karaaiaa.
translation: The Guru bowed before the Lord and the primal Lord made the whole world bow before the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਗੋਵਿੰਦੁ ਨਾੳੁ ਸਦਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aykankaar Akaaru Kari Guru Govindu Naau Sadavaaiaa.
translation: The formless Brahm assuming (human) form has got himself called Guru (Har) Gobind.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਨਿਰਗੁਣ ਸਰਗੁਣ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Niragoun Saragoun Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: Assuming form and being formless at the same time, the transcendental perfect Brahm has made His unmanifest form manifest.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਅਾਰਾਧਿਅਾ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਛਲੁ ਛਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Aaraadhiaa Bhagati Vachhalu Hoi Achhalu Chhalaaiaa.
translation: The holy congregation adored Him; and being in love with the devotees He, the undeceivable, got deluded (and became manifest in the form of Guru).

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ੲਿਕ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aoankaar Akaar Kari Iku Kavaau Pasaau Pasaaiaa.
translation: The Maar assuming form created the whole world by His one commanding vibration.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਮ ਰੋਮ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਖਿਓਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਡੁ ਕਰੋੜਿ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Rom Rom Vichi Rakhiaonu Kari Brahamandu Karorhi Samaaiaa.
translation: In His each trichome He contained millions of universes.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧ ਜਨਾ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਧਿਅਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Saadh Janaa Gur Charan Dhiaaiaa ?1?
translation: The sadhus adore the Lord in the form of the Guru's feet.

gurmukhi: ੨ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਮਾਰਗ
translation: The way of the gurumukh

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗਿ ਪੈਰੁ ਧਰਿ ਦਹਿਦਿਸਿ ਬਾਰਹ ਵਾਟ ਨ ਧਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maaragi Pairu Dhari Dahidisi Baarah Vaat N Dhaaiaa.
translation: The guru-oriented treading the path leading towards the Guru does not stray into the paths of the twelve sects of the yogis.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੂਰਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਧਰਿ ਘਟਿ ਘਟਿ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਦਿਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Moorati Gur Dhiaanu Dhari Ghati Ghati Pooran Braham Dikhaaiaa.
translation: Concentrating on the form of Guru i.e. Word of the Guru, he adopts it in life and comes face to :face with the perfect Brahm.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਲਿਵ ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਜਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Oupadaysu Liv Paarabraham Gur Giaanu Janaaiaa.
translation: Concentration of consciousness on the word of the Guru and knowledge bestowed by the Guru provides the awareness about the transcendental Brahm .

gurmukhi: ਸਿਲਾ ਅਲੂਣੀ ਚਟਣੀ ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਪਿਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Silaa Aloonee Chatanee Charan Kaval Charanodaku Piaaiaa.
translation: Only such a persen quaffs the nectar of feet-wash of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਨਿਹਚਲੁ ਚਿਤ ਕਰਿ ਸੁਖ ਸੰਪਟ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰੁ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramati Nihachalu Chitu Kari Soukh Sanpat Vichi Nij Gharu Chhaaiaa.
translation: This however is nothing less than licking of the tasteless stone. He stablizes his mind in the wisdom of the Guru and reclines comfortably in the chamber of his inner self.

gurmukhi: ਪਰ ਤਨ ਪਰ ਧਨ ਪਰਹਰੇ ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰਸਿ ਅਪਰਸੁ ਰਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Par Tan Par Dhan Paraharay Paarasi Parasi Aparasu Rahaaiaa.
translation: Touching the philosopher's stone in the form of the Guru , he repudiating the wealth and physical body of others remains detached from all.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਿ ਅਸਾਧਿ ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Saadh Asaadhi Saadh Sangi Aaiaa ?2?
translation: For curing his chronic maladies (of evil propensities) he goes to the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ੩ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਾਂ ਦੀ ਬਿਧੀ
translation: Uplift of the gurmukhs

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਵੜ ਬੀੳੁ ਸਜੀੳੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਕਰਿ ਵਿਸਥਾਰੁ ਬਿਰਖੁ ੳੁਪਜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jiu Varh Beeu Sajeeu Hoi Kari Visadaaru Birakhu Oupajaaiaa.
translation: As the seed of banyan tree getting developed extends itself in the form of a large tree

gurmukhi: ਬਿਰਖਹੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਹੰਸ ਫਲ ਫਲ ਫਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਬਹੁ ਬੀਅ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Birakhahu Hoi Sahans Phal Phal Phal Vichi Bahu Beea Samaaiaa.
translation: And then on that very tree grow thousands of fruits containing myriad seeds (likewise gurmukh makes others like his own self).

gurmukhi: ਦੁਤੀਅਾ ਚੰਦੁ ਅਗਾਸ ਜਿੳੁ ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Douteeaa Chandu Agaas Jiu Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Karaaiaa.
translation: That primal Lord, like the second day's moon in the sky, gets himself worshipped iby one and all.

gurmukhi: ਤਾਰੇ ਮੰਡਲ ਸੰਤ ਜਨ ਧਰਮ ਸਾਲ ਸਚਖੰਡ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Taaray Mandalu Sant Jan Dharamasaal Sach Khand Vasaaiaa.
translation: The saints are constellation inhabiting the abode of truth in the form of religious places.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਜਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paakhaak Hoi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Janaaiaa.
translation: They bowing at the feet and becoming dust of , the feet lose there ego and never allow themselves to be noticed by any one.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਧ੍ਰੂ ਜਿਵੈ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਵਾਸ ਅਗਾਸੁ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Dhr Jivai Nihachal Vaasu Agaasu Charhhaaiaa.
translation: Attainer of the pleasure fruit, the gurmukh lives steadfastly like the pole star in the sky.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਤਾਰੇ ਚੳੁਫੇਰਿ ਫਿਰਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੩॥
transliteration: Sabh Taaray Chaudhayri Dhiraaiaa ?3?
translation: All the stars revolve around him.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਭਗਤ ਨਾਮਦੇਵ
translation: Namdev, the saint

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਾ ਛੀਂਬਾ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Naamaa Chheenbaa Aakheeai Guramoukhi Bhaai Bhagati Liv Laaee.
translation: Namdev, the calico minter having become gurmukh merged his consciousness in loving devotion.

gurmukhi: ਖਤ੍ਰੀ ਬ੍ਹਮਣ ਦੇਹੁਰੈ ੳੁਤਮ ਜਾਤਿ ਕਰਨਿ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Khatree Braahaman Dayhurai Outam Jaati Karani Vadiaaee.
translation: High caste kshatriyas and Brahmins who went to temple to eulogize the Lord caught hold and ousted Namdev.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮ ਪਕੜਿ ੳੁਠਾਲਿਅਾ ਬਹਿ ਪਿਛਵਾੜੈ ਹਰਿ ਗੁਣ ਗਾੲੀ
transliteration: Naamaa Pakarhi Outdaaliaa Bahi Pachhavaarhai Hari Goun Gaaee.
translation: While sitting in the back yard of the temple, he started singing the praises of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤ ਵਛਲ ਅਾਖਾੲਿਦਾ ਫੇਰਿ ਦੇਹੁਰਾ ਪੈਜਿ ਰਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhagat Vachhalu Aakhaaidaa Dhayri Dayhuraa Paiji Rakhaaee.
translation: The Lord known as kind to devotees turned the face of the temple towards him and maintained His own reputation.

gurmukhi: ਦਰਗਹ ਮਾਣੁ ਨਿਮਾਣਿਅਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Daragah Maanu Nimaaniaa Saadhasangati Satigur Saranaaee.
translation: In the shelter of  holy congregation, the true Guru and the Lord, the humble ones also get honour.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤਮੁ ਪਦਵੀ ਨੀਚ ਜਾਤਿ ਚਾਰੇ ਵਰਣ ਪੲੇ ਪਗ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Outamu Padavee Neech Jaati Chaaray Varan Paay Pagi Aaee.
translation: High, ranking as well as the so-called low castes i.e. all the four as fell at the feet of Namdev

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਨੀਵਾਣਿ ਨੀਰੁ ਚਲਿ ਜਾੲੀ ॥੪॥
transliteration: Jiu Neevaani Neeru Chali Jaaee ?4?
translation: Just as the water flows down towards low

gurmukhi: ੫ ਭਗਤਾਂ ਦੀ ਜਾਤ ਨਹੀਂ
translation: The saints have no caste

gurmukhi: ਅਸੁਰ ਭਭੀਖਣੁ ਭਗਤੁ ਹੈ ਬਿਦਰੁ ਧ੍ਰੂ ਵਿਖਲੀ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Asur Bhabheekhanu Bhagatu Hai Bidaru Su Vikhalee Pat Saranaaee.
translation: Saint Vibhisaa a demon, and Vidur son of maid servant came in the shelter of the Lord. Dhanni is known as a jai

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨਾ ਜਟੁ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਸਧਨਾ ਜਾਤਿ ਅਜਾਤਿ ਕਸਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dhannaa Jatu Vakhaaneeai Sadhanaa Jaati Ajaati Kasaaee.
translation: And Sadhana was an out caste butcher. Saint Kabir was a weaver

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੁਲਾਹੜਾ ਨਾਮਾ ਛੀਂਬਾ ਹਰਿ ਗੁਣ ਗਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhagatu Kabeeru Julaaharhaa Naamaa Chheenbaa Hari Goun Gaaee.
translation: And Namdev a calicoprinter who sang the praises of the Lord. Ravidas was a cobbler and saint Sairt belonged to (the so-called ) low barber caste.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਲਿ ਰਵਿਦਾਸੁ ਚਮਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਸੈਣੁ ਸਨਾਤੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਨਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kuli Ravidaasu Chamaaru Hai Sainu Sanaatee Andari Naaee.
translation: Female crow takes care of the fledgelings of nightingale but they ultimately meet their own family.

gurmukhi: ਕੋੲਿਲ ਪਾਲੈ ਕਾਵਣੀ ਅੰਤਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਅਪਣੇ ਕੁਲ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Koil Paalai Kaavanee Anti Milai Apanay Kul Jaaee.
translation: Though Yagoda nurtured Krsna, yet he came to be known as the lotus (son) ) of the family of Vasudev.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸਨੁ ਜਸੋਧਾ ਪਾਲਿਅਾ ਵਾਸਦੇਵ ਕੁਲ ਕਵਲ ਸਦਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kisanu Jasodhaa Paaliaa Vaasadayv Kul Kaval Sadaaee.
translation: As the pot of any type containing ghee is not said to be bad,

gurmukhi: ਘਿਅ ਭਾਂਡਾ ਨ ਵੀਚਾਰੀਅੈ ਭਗਤਾ ਜਾਤਿ ਸਨਾਤ ਨ ਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ghia Bhaandaa N Vichaareeai Bhagataa Jaati Sanaati N Kaaee.
translation: Likewise, the saints also have no high or low caste whatsoever.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Charan Kaval Satigur Saranaaee ?5?
translation: They all remain in the shelter of the lotus feet of the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਨੀਚ ਥਾਓਂ ੳੁੱਤਮ ਵਸਤਾਂ ਦੇ ਦ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਟਾਂਤ
translation: Examples of the lowly places and the best articles

gurmukhi: ਡੇਮੂੰ ਖਖਰਿ ਮਿਸਰੀ ਮਖੀ ਮੇਲੁ ਮਖੀਰੁ ੳੁਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Daymoon Khakhari Misaree Makhee Maylu Makheeru Oupaaiaa.
translation: From hornets' nest lump sugar and by honey bees the honey hive is produced.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਟ ਪਟੰਬਰਿ ਕੀੜਿਅਹੁ ਕੁਟਿ ਕਟਿ ਸਣੁ ਕਿਰਤਾਸੁ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paat Patanbar Keerhiahu Kouti Kati Sanu Kirataasu Banaaiaa.
translation: From worms is produced silk and by pounding the hemp, paper is prepared.

gurmukhi: ਮਲਮਲ ਹੋੲਿ ਵੜੇਵਿਅਹੁ ਚਿਕੜਿ ਕਵਲੁ ਭਵਰੁ ਲੋਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Malamal Hoi Varhayviahu Chikarhi Kavalu Bhavaru Lobhaaiaa.
translation: Muslin is prepared from cotton seed and in the mire grows the lotus on the black bee gets enamoured.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਮਣਿ ਕਾਲੇ ਸਪ ਸਿਰਿ ਪਥਰੁ ਹੀਰੇ ਮਾਣਕ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jiu Mani Kaalay Sap Siri Padaru Heeray Maanak Chhaaiaa.
translation: A gem remains in the hood of black snake  and among the stones are found diamonds and rubies.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣੁ ਕਥੂਰੀ ਮਿਰਗ ਤਨਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਭਗੳੁਤੀ ਲੋਹੁ ਘੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jaanu Kadooree Mirag Tani Naau Bhagaoutee Lohu Gharhaaiaa.
translation: The musk is found in the navel of deer and from ordinary iron the powerful sword is aced.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸਕੁ ਬਿਲੀਅਹੁ ਮੇਦੁ ਕਰਿ ਮਜਲਸ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਮਹ ਮਹਕਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Mousaku Bileeahu Maydu Kari Majalas Andari Mah Mahakaaiaa.
translation: The brain marrow of musk cat makes the whole gethering fragrant.

gurmukhi: ਨੀਚ ਜੋਨਿ ੳੁਤਮੁ ਫਲੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Neech Joni Outamu Phalu Paaiaa ?6?
translation: Thus the creatures and materials of lower species give and attain the highest fruits.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਰਾਜਾ ਬਲਿ ਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਗ
translation: Tale of Bali, the King

gurmukhi: ਬਲਿ ਪੋਤਾ ਪ੍ਹਿਲਾਦ ਦਾ ੲਿੰਦਰ ਪੁਰੀ ਦੀ ੲਿਛ ੲਿਛੰਦਾ
transliteration: Bali Potaa Prahilaad Daa Indar Puree Dee Ichh Ichhandaa.
translation: Son of Virochan and grand son of Prahalad, king Bali, had a desire of ruling the abode of Indr.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿ ਸੰਪੂਰਣੁ ਜਗੁ ਸੳੁ ੲਿਕ ੲਿਕੋਤਰੁ ਜਗੁ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Kari Sanpooranu Jagu Sau Ik Ikotaru Jagu Karandaa.
translation: He had accomplished hundred yajns (burnt  offerings) and his other hudred yajns were in progress.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਵਨ ਰੂਪੀ ਅਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਗਰਬੁ ਨਿਵਾਰਿ ਭਗਤ ੳੁਧਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Baavan Roopee Aai Kai Garabu Nivaari Bhagat Udharandaa.
translation: Lord in the form of a dwarf came to remove his ego and thus liberated him.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰਾਸਣ ਨੋ ਪਰਹਰੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਪਤਾਲਿ ਸੁ ਹੁਕਮੀ ਬੰਦਾ
transliteration: Indraasan No Paraharai Jaai Pataali Su Houkamee Bandaa.
translation: He repudiated the throne of Indr and like an obedient servant went to the nether world.

gurmukhi: ਬਲਿ ਛਲਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਛਲਾੲਿਓਨੁ ਦਰਵਾਜੇ ਦਰਵਾਨ ਹੋਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Bali Chhali Aapu Chhalaaiaonu Daravaajay Daravaan Hovandaa.
translation: The Lord Himself got enamoured of Bali and had to stay as a door keeper of Bali.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਵਾਂਤਿ ਬੂੰਦ ਲੈ ਸਿਪ ਜਿੳੁ ਮੋਤੀ ਚੁਭੀ ਮਾਰਿ ਸੁਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Saati Boond Lai Sip Jiu Motee Choubhee Maari Suhandaa.
translation: Bali, the king is like that shell which in the svati naksatr (a special star formation) receiving a drop and making it a pearl dives deep at the bottom of the sea.

gurmukhi: ਹੀਰੈ ਹੀਰਾ ਬੇਧਿ ਮਿਲੰਦਾ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Heerai Heeraa Baydhi Miladaa ?7?
translation: The diamond heart of devotee Bali, cut by the diamond Lord was finally subsumed in Him.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਕੀੜੀ
translation: Example of an ant

gurmukhi: ਨੀਚਹੁ ਨੀਚ ਸਦਾਵਣਾ ਕੀੜੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Neechahu Neech Sadaavanaa Keerhee Hoi N Aapu Ganaaay.
translation: Ants never make themselves noticed and are known lowest among the lowly.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗਿ ਚਲਣਾ ੲਿਕਤੁ ਖਡੁ ਸਹੰਸ ਸਮਾੲੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maaragi Chalanaa Ikatu Khadu Sahans Samaaay.
translation: They follow the path of gurmukhs and due to their broad mindedness they live in thousands, in a small hole.

gurmukhi: ਘਿਅ ਸਕਰ ਦੀ ਵਾਸ ਲੈ ਜਿਥੈ ਧਰੀ ਤਿਥੈ ਚਲਿ ਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Ghia Sakar Dee Vaasu Lai Jidai Dharee Tidai Chali Jaaay.
translation: Only by smelling ghee and sugar, they reach the place where these things are kept (gurmukhs also search out he holy congregations).

gurmukhi: ਡੁਲੈ ਖੰਡੁ ਜੁ ਰੇਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਖੰਡੂ ਦਾਣਾ ਚੁਣਿ ਚੁਣਿ ਖਾੲੇ
transliteration: Dulai Khandu Ju Raytu Vichi Khandoo Daanaa Chouni Chouni Khaaay.
translation: They pick up the sugar bits scattered in sand similarly as a gurmukh  cherishes the virtues.

gurmukhi: ਭ੍ਰਿੰਗੀ ਦੇ ਭੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਮਰਿ ਹੋਵੈ ਭ੍ਰਿੰਗੀ ਮਾਰਿ ਜੀਵਾੲੇ
transliteration: Bhringee Day Bhai Jaai Mari Hovai Bhringee Maari Jeevaaay.
translation: Dying of the fear of worm bhringi the ant itself becomes bhringi and makes others also like itself.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਡਾ ਕਛੂ ਕੂੰਜ ਦਾ ਅਾਸਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਿਰਾਸੁ ਵਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Andaa Kachhoo Koonj Daa Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaay.
translation: Like the eggs of heron and tortoise, it (ant) remains detached amidst hopes.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖੁ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਪਾੲੇ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Gurasikhu Soukh Phalu Paaay ?8?
translation: Similarly gurmukhs also getting educated attain the pleasure fruits.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਨਿੱਕੇ ਹੋਣ ਪੁਰ ਲੋਕ ਪ੍ਰਸਿੱਧ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਗ
translation: Many a story of becoming humble

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਪਾਸਿ ਬਿਅਾਸੁ ਜਾੲਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਭੁਣਹਣਾ ਕੰਨਿ ਸਮਾਣਾ
transliteration: Sooraj Paasi Biaasu Jaai Hoi Bhounahanaa Kanni Samaanaa.
translation: Rishi Vyas went to sun and becoming a small insect entered into his ear i.e. most humbly he remained with him and got educated by sun).

gurmukhi: ਪੜ੍ਹਿ ਵਿਦਿਅਾ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਬਾਲਮੀਕ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਣਾ
transliteration: Parhhi Vidiaa Ghari Aaiaa Guramoukhi Baalameek Mani Bhaanaa.
translation: Valmiki also only becoming guru- oriented attained knowledge and then he returned home.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਬਿਅਾਸ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਕਥਿ ਕਥਿ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਵੇਦ ਪੁਰਾਣਾ
transliteration: Aadi Biaas Vakhaaneeai Kadi Kadi Saasatr Vayd Puraanaa.
translation: The exponent of many stories of the Vedas, Shastras and the Puranas Valmili is known as the primal poet.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰਦਿ ਮੁਨਿ ੳੁਪਦੇਸਿਅਾ ਭਗਤਿ ਭਾਗਵਤੁ ਪੜ੍ਹਿ ਪਤੀਅਾਣਾ
transliteration: Naaradi Mouni Oupadaysiaa Bhagati Bhaagavatu Parhhi Pateeaanaa.
translation: Sage Narad  preached to him and only after reading the Blia-gavat of devotion he could attain peace.

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਦਹ ਵਿਦਿਅਾ ਸੋਧਿਕੈ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੁ ਅਚਾਰੁ ਸੁਖਾਣਾ
transliteration: Chaudah Vidiaa Sodhi Kai Paraoupakaaru Achaaru Soukhaanaa.
translation: He researched  the fourteen skills but ultimately he got happiness due to his benevolent conduct.

gurmukhi: ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ਸਾਧਸੰਗੁ ਪਤਿਤ ੳੁਧਾਰਣੁ ਬਿਰਦੁ ਵਖਾਣਾ
transliteration: Paraoupakaaree Saadhasangu Patit Udhaaranu Biradu Vakhaanaa.
translation: Association with such humble sadhus is altruistic and makes one habitual liberates of the fallen ones.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਤਿ ਪਰਵਾਣਾ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Pati Paravaanaa ?9?
translation: Gurmukhs attain pleasure fruits in it and get dignified acceptance in the court of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਸੁਕਦੇਵ
translation: Sukadev

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਵਰ੍ਹੇ ਗਰਭਾਸਿ ਵਸਿ ਜੰਮਦੇ ਹੀ ਸੁਕਿ ਲੲੀ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ
transliteration: Baarah Varhay Garabhaasi Vasi Jamaday Hee Souki Laee Udaasee.
translation: Having remained in his mother's womb for twelve years, Sukadev adopted  detachedness right form the very time of his birth.

gurmukhi: ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਤੀਤ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਨ ਹਠ ਬੁਧਿ ਨ ਬੰਦਿਖਲਾਸੀ
transliteration: Maaiaa Vichi Ateet Hoi Man Hatd Budhi N Bandi Khalaasee.
translation: Though he went beyond  maya yet because of his intellect pushed by stubbornness of mind, he could not attain liberation.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਤਾ ਬਿਅਾਸ ਪਰਬੋਧਿਅਾ ਗੁਰ ਕਰਿ ਜਨਕ ਸਹਜ ਅਭਿਅਾਸੀ
transliteration: Pia Biaas Parabodhiaa Gur Kari Janak Sahaj Abhiaasee.
translation: His father Vyas made him understand that he should adopt king Janak as his guru who is well grounded in the art of remaining in equipoise.

gurmukhi: ਤਜਿ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਲੲੀ ਸਿਰ ਧਰਿ ਜੂਠਿ ਮਿਲੀ ਸਾਬਾਸੀ
transliteration: Taji Duramati Guramati Laee Sir Dhari Jootdi Milee Saabaasee.
translation: Doing so, and divesting himself of the evil wisdom,he acquired he wisdom of Guru and as ordered by his guru he carried left overs on his head and thus earned pats from the guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਅਵੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਗਰਬਿ ਨਿਵਾਰਿ ਜਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਦਾਸੀ
transliteration: Guraoupadaysu Avaysu Kari Garabi Nivaari Jagati Guradaasee.
translation: When inspired by the teachings f the guru he repudiated ego, the whole world accepted him as guru and  became his servant .

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੀ
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Guramati Bhaau Bhagati Paragaasee.
translation: By falling at the feet, by becoming dust of the feet and by the wisdom of the guru, loving devotion came up in him.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਸਹਜ ਨਿਵਾਸੀ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Sahaj Nivaasee ?10?
translation: As a gurmukh attaining pleasure fruit he got himself lodged in equipoise.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਗੁਰ ਸਿੱਖਾਂ ਦੀ ਵਿਸ਼ੇਖਤਾ
translation: Virtues of the Sikhs of Guru

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੁ ਜੋਗੁ ਹੈ ਜਨਕ ਦੇ ਵਡਾ ਭਗਤੁ ਕਰਿ ਵੇਦ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Raaj Jogu Hai Janak Day Vadaa Bhagatu Kari Vaydu Vakhaanai.
translation: Janak is a king as well as a yogi and the books of knowledge describe him as great devotee.

gurmukhi: ਸਨਕਾਦਿਕ ਨਾਰਦ ੳੁਦਾਸ ਬਾਲ ਸੁਭਾੲਿ ਅਤੀਤੁ ਸੁਹਾਣੈ
transliteration: Sanakaadik Naarad Udaas Baal Soubhaai Ateetu Suhaanai.
translation: Sanaks and Narad from their very childhood were of detached nature and adorned themselves with indifference to all.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਲਖ ਲੰਘਿ ਕੈ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਨਿਰਬਾਣੈ
transliteration: Jog Bhog Lakh Laghi Kai Gurasikh Saadhasangati Nirabaanai.
translation: Going beyond millions of detachments and enjoyments, the Sikhs of Guru also remain humble m the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿ ਵਿਗੁਚਣਾ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲੇ ਅਾਪੁ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ
transliteration: Aapu Ganaai Vigouchanaa Aapu Gavaaay Aapu Siaanai.
translation: He who gets himself counted or noticed goes astray in illusions; but he who loses his ego infact identifies his self.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗੁ ਸਚ ਦਾ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਵਣਾ ਰਾਜੇ ਰਾਣੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maaragu Sach Daa Pairee Pavanaa Raajay Raanai.
translation: Gurmukh' s way is the way of truth whereby all the kings and emperors fall on his feet.

gurmukhi: ਗਰਬੁ ਗੁਮਾਨੁ ਵਿਸਾਰਿਕੈ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਰਿਦੈ ਗਰੀਬੀ ਅਾਣੈ
transliteration: Garabu Goumaanu Visaari Kai Guramati Ridai Gareebee Aanai.
translation: Treader of this path, forgetting his ego and pride cherishes humility in his heart through the wisdom of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੀ ਦਰਗਹ ਮਾਣੁ ਨਿਮਾਣੈ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Sachee Daragah Maanu Nimaanai ?11?
translation: Such an humble person gets respects and regards in the true court.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਚਰਣੋਦਿਕ ਵਿਸ਼ੇਖਤਾ
translation: Virtues of the feet wash

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰੁ ੳੁਚਾ ਅਭਿਮਾਨੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਾਲਖ ਭਰਿਅਾ ਕਾਲੇ ਵਾਲਾ
transliteration: Siru Ouchaa Abhimaanu Vichi Kaalakh Bhariaa Kaalay Vaalaa.
translation: Proud head remains erect and high yet it is coveved by the blackness of hair.

gurmukhi: ਭਰਵਟੇ ਕਾਲਖ ਭਰੇ ਪਿਪਣੀਅਾਂ ਕਾਲਖ ਸੂਰਾਲਾ
transliteration: Bharavatay Kaalakh Bharay Pipaneeaa Kaalakh Sooraalaa.
translation: Eyebrows are full of blackness and the eye lashes are also like black thorns.

gurmukhi: ਲੋੲਿਣ ਕਾਲੇ ਜਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਦਾੜੀ ਮੁਛਾ ਕਰਿ ਮੁਹ ਕਾਲਾ
transliteration: Loin Kaalay Jaaneeani Daarhee Mouchhaa Kari Muh Kaalaa.
translation: Eyes are black (in India) and like wise beards and moustaches are also black.

gurmukhi: ਨਕ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਨਕ ਵਾਲ ਬਹੁ ਲੂੰੲਿ ਲੂੰੲਿ ਕਾਲਖ ਬੇਤਾਲਾ
transliteration: Nak Andari Nak Vaal Bahu Looi Looi Kaalakh Baytaalaa.
translation: Many trichomes are there in the nose and all of them are black.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਚੈ ਅੰਗ ਨ ਪੂਜੀਅਨਿ ਚਰਣ ਧੂੜਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਧਰਮਸਾਲਾ
transliteration: Ouchai Ang N Poojeeani Charan Dhoorhi Guramoukhi Dharamasaalaa.
translation: Organs placed higher are not worshipped and the dust of the feet of gurmukhs  is adorable like holy places .

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰਾ ਨਖ ਮੁਖ ੳੁਜਲੇ ਭਾਰੁ ੳੁਚਾੲਿਨਿ ਦੇਹੁ ਦੁਰਾਲਾ
transliteration: Pairaa Nakh Moukh Ujalay Bhaaru Ouchaaini Dayhu Duraalaa.
translation: Feet and nails are blessed because they carry`the load of the whole body.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰ ਧੋਵਣੁ ਅਪਵਿੱਤ੍ਰ ਹੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਚਰਣੋਦਕ ਜਗ ਭਾਲਾ
transliteration: Sir Dhovanu Apavitr Hai Guramoukhi Charanodak Jagi Bhaalaa.
translation: The head wash is considered dirty but the feet wash of the gurmukhs is sought after by the whole world.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਸਹਜੁ ਸੁਖਾਲਾ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Sahaju Soukhaalaa ?12?
translation: Attaining the pleasure fruit the gurmukhs in their equipoise, remain as the store house of all delights.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ੲੀਸ਼੍ਵਰੀਯ ਰਚਨਾ
translation: Godly creation

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਧਰਤੀ ਧਰਮਸਾਲ ਧਰਤੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਨੀਰ ਨਿਵਾਸਾ
transliteration: Jal Vichi Dharatee Dharamasaal Dharatee Andari Neer Nivaasaa.
translation: Earth, the abode for the conduct of dharma is supported by water and inside earth,too, resides water.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਸਰਣਾਗਤੀ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਧੀਰਜੁ ਧਰਮੁ ਸੁਵਾਸਾ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Saranaagatee Nihachal Dheeraju Dharamu Suvaasaa.
translation: Coming into the shelter of the lotus feet (of the Guru), the earth is pervaded by the fragrance of firm fortitude, and dharma.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਰਖ ਬਿਰਖ ਕੁਸਮਾਵਲੀ ਬੂਟੀ ਜੜੀ ਘਾਹ ਅਬਿਨਾਸਾ
transliteration: Kirakh Birakh Kousamaavalee Bootee Jarhee Ghaah Abinaasaa.
translation: On it (earth) grow trees, lines of flowers, herbs and grass which never exhaust.

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਸਾੲਿਰ ਗਿਰਿ ਮੇਰੁ ਬਹੁ ਰਤਨ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਭੋਗ ਬਿਲਾਸਾ
transliteration: Sar Saair Giri Mayru Bahu Ratan Padaarad Bhog Bilaasaa.
translation: Many a pond, ocean, mountain, jewel and pleasure giving material are there on it.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵ ਸਥਲ ਤੀਰਥ ਘਣੇ ਰੰਗ ਰੂਪ ਰਸ ਕਸ ਪਰਗਾਸਾ
transliteration: Dayv Sadal Teerad Ghanay Rang Roop Ras Ras Paragaasaa.
translation: Many godly places, pilgrimage centres, hues, forms, edibles and inedibles come forth from it.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲੇ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਣਤਾਸਾ
transliteration: Gur Chaylay Raharaasi Kari Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Gounataasaa.
translation: Owing to the tradition of the Guru-disciple, the holy congregation of the gurmukhs is also a similar ocean of virtues.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਾਸ ਨਿਰਾਸਾ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Aas Niraasaa ?13?
translation: Remaining detached amidst hopes and desires is the pleasure fruit for the gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਸਾਧ ਚਰਣ ਪੂਜਾ
translation: Worship of the feet of sadhu

gurmukhi: ਰੋਮ ਰੋਮ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਖਿਓਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਡ ਕਰੋੜਿ ਸਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Rom Rom Vichi Rakhiaonu Kari Brahamand Karorhi Samaaee.
translation: The Lord has subsumed crores of universes in His each trichome.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਸਤਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੁਖਦਾੲੀ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Sati Purakh Satiguru Soukhadaaee.
translation: The true Guru form of that primal perfect and transcendental Brahm is bestower of delights.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chaari Varan Gurasikh Hoi Saadhasangati Satigur Saranaaee.
translation: All the four vamas come to the shelter of the true Guru in the form of holy congregation

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਸਿਮਰਣਿ ਸਦਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਬਦਿ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Giaan Dhiaan Simarani Sadaa Guramoukhi Sabadi Suratili Valaaee.
translation: And the gurmukhs there merge their consciousness in the Word through learning, meditation and, prayer.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੳੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਰਿਦੇ ਵਸਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhaai Bhagati Bhau Piram Ras Satiguru Moorati Riday Vasaaee.
translation: Fear of the Lord, loving devotion and the delight of love, for them, is the idol of the true Guru whom they cherish in their heart.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਵਡੁ ਭਾਰੁ ੳੁਚਾੲਿਂਦੇ ਸਾਧ ਚਰਣ ਪੂਜਾ ਗੁਰ ਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ayvadu Bhaaru Ouchaaiday Saadh Charan Poojaa Gur Bhaaee.
translation: The feet of the true Guru in the form of sadhu bear so much load (mental as well as spiritual) of their disciples that,

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਕੀਮ ਨ ਪਾੲੀ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Keem N Paaee ?14?
translation: 0 my brothers you, ought to worship them. The value of the pleasure fruit of the gunnukhs cannot be estimated.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਅਨ੍ਰਯਾੲੀ ਰਾਜੇ
translation: Unjust kings

gurmukhi: ਵਸੈ ਛਹਬਰ ਲਾੲਿਕੈ ਪਰਨਾਲੀਂ ਹੁੲਿ ਵੀਹੀਂ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Vasai Chhahabar Laai Kai Paranaaleen Hui Veeheen Aavai.
translation: When it rains cats and dogs, the water flowing through gargoyles comes down in the streets.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਨਾਲੇ ੳੁਛਲ ਚਲਨਿ ਲਖ ਪਰਵਾਹੀ ਵਾਹ ਵਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Lakh Naalay Ouchhal Chalani Lakh Paravaahee Vaah Vahaavai.
translation: Millions of streams overflowing become millions of currents.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਨਾਲੇ ਲਖ ਵਾਹਿ ਵਹਿ ਨਦੀਅਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਰਲੇ ਰਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Lakh Naalay Lakh Vaahi Vahi Nadeeaa Andari Ralay Ralaavai.
translation: Millions of rivulets join the currents of rivers.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਸੈ ਨਦੀ ਨੜਿੰਨਵੈ ਪੂਰਬਿ ਪਛਮਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਚਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Nau Sai Nadee Narhinnavai Poorabi Pachhami Hoi Chalaavai.
translation: Nine hundred and ninety nine rivers flow in the east and the west directions.

gurmukhi: ਨਦੀਅਾ ਜਾੲਿ ਸਮੁੰਦ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਾਗਰ ਸੰਗਮੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਿਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Nadeeaa Jaai Samound Vichi Saagar Sangamu Hoi Milaavai.
translation: Rivers go to meet the sea.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿ ਸਮੁੰਦ ਗੜਾੜ ਮਹਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਹਿ ਨ ਪੇਟੁ ਭਰਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sati Samound Garhaarh Mahi Jaai Samaahi N Paytu Bharaavai.
translation: Seven such seas merge into the oceans but still the oceans are not satiated.

gurmukhi: ਜਾੲਿ ਗੜਾੜੁ ਪਤਾਲ ਹੇਠਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਤਵੇ ਦੀ ਬੂੰਦ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jaai Garhaarhu Pataal Haytdi Hoi Tavay Dee Boond Samaavai.
translation: In the nether world, such oceans also look like a drop of water on a hot plate.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰ ਪਤਿਸਾਹਾ ਲਖ ਲਖ ੲਿੰਨਣੁ ਜਾਲਿ ਤਵੇ ਨੋ ਤਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sir Patisaahaan Lakh Lakh Innanu Jaali Tavay No Taavai.
translation: To heat this plate, millions of heads of the emperors are used as fuel.

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦੇ ਖਹਿ ਖਹਿ ਦੁਨੀਅਾ ਦਾਵੈ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Maraday Khahi Khahi Douneeaa Daavai ?15?
translation: And these emperors staking their claims on this earth go on fighting and dying.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਦੋ ਪਾਤਸ਼ਾਹ-ਵੀਹ ਫਕੀਰ
translation: Two Kings and twenty faquirs -

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਤੁ ਥੇਕੈ ਦੁੲਿ ਖੜਗੁ ਦੁੲਿ ਪਾਤਸਾਹ ਨ ਮੁਲਕਿ ਸਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Ikatu Daykai Dui Kharhagu Dui Paatisaah N Mulaki Samaanai.
translation: In one sheath two swords and two emperors in one country cannot be accommodated;

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ਫਕੀਰ ਮਸੀਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਖਿੰਥ ਖਿੰਧੋਲੀ ਹੇਠਿ ਲੁਕਾਣੈ
transliteration: Veeh Dhakeer Maseeti Vichi Khind Khindholee Haytdi Loukaanai.
translation: But twenty faquirs in one mosque under one patched blanket can remain (comfortably).

gurmukhi: ਜੰਗਲ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸੀਹ ਦੁੲਿ ਪੋਸਤ ਡੋਡੇ ਖਸਖਸ ਦਾਣੈ
transliteration: Jangal Andari Seeh Dui Posat Doday Khasakhas Daanai.
translation: Emperors are like two lions in a jungle whereas the faquirs are like the opium seeds in one pod.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਲੀ ੳੁਪਰਿ ਖੇਲਣਾ ਸਿਰਿ ਧਰਿ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਬਜਾਰ ਵਿਕਾਣੈ
transliteration: Soolee Oupari Khaylanaa Siri Dhari Chhatr Bajaar Vikaanai.
translation: These seeds play on the 'bed of thorns before they get the honour of selling in the market.

gurmukhi: ਕੋਲੂ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਪੀੜੀਅਨਿ ਪੋਸਤਿ ਪੀਹਿ ਪਿਅਾਲੇ ਛਾਣੈ
transliteration: Koloo Andari Peerheeani Posati Peehi Piaalay Chhaanai.
translation: They are rushed in the press with water before they are strained into the cup .

gurmukhi: ਲੳੁਬਾਲੀ ਦਰਗਾਹ ਵਿਚਿ ਗਰਬੁ ਗੁਨਾਹੀ ਮਾਣੁ ਨਿਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Laoubaalee Daragaah Vichi Garabu Gounaahee Maanu Nimaanai.
translation: In the court of the fearless Lord, the proud ones are called sinners and the humble get respects and regards.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਹੋਂਦੇ ਤਾਣਿ ਨਿਤਾਣੈ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Honday Taani Nitaanai ?16?
translation: That is why the gurmukhs though powerful behave as the meek ones.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਬੱਕਰੀ
translation: She goat

gurmukhi: ਸੀਹ ਪਜੂਤੀ ਬਕਰੀ ਮਰਦੀ ਹੋੲੀ ਹੜ ਹੜ ਹਸੀ
transliteration: Seeh Pajootee Bakaree Maradee Hoee Harh Harh Hasee.
translation: A goat was caught by a lion and while about to die, it gave out a horse­ laugh.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਹੁ ਪੁਛੈ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਹੋੲਿ ੲਿਤੁ ਅੳੁਸਰ ਕਿਤੁ ਰਹਸਿ ਰਹਸੀ
transliteration: Seehu Pouchhai Visamaadu Hoi Itu Aousari Kitu Rahasi Rahasee.
translation: The surprised lion asked why it was so happy at such a moment (of its death).

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨੳੁ ਕਰੇਂਦੀ ਬਕਰੀ ਪੁਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਾਡੇ ਕੀਚਨਿ ਖਸੀ
transliteration: Binau Karayndee Bakaree Poutr Asaaday Keechani Khasee.
translation: Humbly the goat replied that the testicals of our male progeny are crushed in order to castrate them.

gurmukhi: ਅਕ ਧਤੂਰਾ ਖਾਧਿਅਾ ਕੁਹਿ ਕੁਹਿ ਖਲ ੳੁਖਲਿ ਵਿਣਸੀ
transliteration: Ak Dhatooraa Khaadhiaan Kuhi Kuhi Khal Oukhali Vinasee.
translation: We eat only wild plants of arid regions yet our skin is peeled and pounded.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਸੁ ਖਾਨਿ ਗਲ ਵਢਿਕੈ ਹਾਲੁ ਤਿਨਾੜਾ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਹੋਵਸੀ
transliteration: Maasu Khaani Gal Vaddhi Kai Haalu Tinaarhaa Kaounu Hovasee.
translation: I think about the plight of those (like you) who cut the throat of others and eat their flesh.

gurmukhi: ਗਰਬੁ ਗਰੀਬੀ ਦੇਹ ਖੇਹ ਖਾਜੁ ਅਖਾਜੁ ਅਕਾਜੁ ਕਰਸੀ
transliteration: Garabu Gareebee Dayh Khayh Khaaju Akhaaju Akaaju Karasee.
translation: The body of both of the proud and the humble will become dust ultimately, but, even then the body of the arrogant (lion) is inedible and that of the humble (goat) attaims the status of edible.

gurmukhi: ਜਗਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਸਭ ਕੋੲਿ ਮਰਸੀ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Jagi Aaiaa Sabh Koi Marasee ?17?
translation: All who came to this world have to die ultimately.

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੀ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Raharaasi Kari Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Paragaasee.
translation: By remaining in and around the lotus feet, the gurmukh receives the light of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਲੇਖ ਅਲੇਖ ਅਮਰ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paakhaak Hoi Laykh Alaykh Amar Abinaasee.
translation: Worshipping the feet and becoming the dust of the feet one becomes detached , immortal and indestructible .

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿ ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਅਾਚਮਨ ਅਾਧਿ ਬਿਅਾਧਿ ੳੁਪਾਧਿ ਖਲਾਸੀ
transliteration: Kari Charanodaku Aachamaan Aadhi Biaadhi Oupaadhi Khalaasee.
translation: Drinking the ash of the feet of gurmukhs, freedom from all physical mental and spiritual ailments is attained.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿਅਾ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਕਰਨਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ
transliteration: Guramati Aapu Gavaaiaa Maaiaa Andari Karani Udaasee.
translation: Through the wisdom of the Guru they lose, their ego and do not get absorbed in maya.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵਲੀਣੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਸਚਖੰਡਿ ਨਿਵਾਸੀ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Livaleenu Hoi Nirankaar Sach Khandi Nivaasee.
translation: Absorbing their consciousness in the word, they reside in the true abode (holy congregation) of the formless one.

gurmukhi: ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਬੋਧਿ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਅਚਰਜ ਗੁਰਦਾਸੀ
transliteration: Abigati Gati Agaadhi Bodhi Akad Kadaa Acharaj Guradaasee.
translation: The tale of the servants of the Lord is unfathomable ineffable and Manifest.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਾਸ ਨਿਰਾਸੀ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Aas Niraasee ?18?
translation: Remaining indifferent to hopes is the pleasure fruit of the Gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਸਤਿਸੰਗ ਨਿਰਦੋਖ ਤਾਰਦਾ ਹੈ
translation: Holy congregation liberates even the knaves

gurmukhi: ਸਣ ਵਣ ਵਾੜੀ ਖੇਤੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੁ ਵਿਕਾਰ ਜਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: San Van Vaarhee Khaytu Iku Paraoupakaaru Vikaaru Janaavai.
translation: Hemp and cotton grow in the same field but the use of one is benevolent while the other one is put to evil use.

gurmukhi: ਖਲ ਕਢਾਹਿ ਵਟਾੲਿ ਸਣ ਰਸਾ ਬੰਧਨੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਬਨ੍ਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Khal Kaddhaahi Vataai San Rasaa Bandhanu Hoi Banhaavai.
translation: After peeling off the hemp plant rope is made whose nooses are used to tie people in bondage.

gurmukhi: ਖਾਸਾ ਮਲਮਲ ਸਿਰੀਸਾਫੁ ਸੂਤੁ ਕਤਾੲਿ ਕਪਾਹ ਵੁਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Khaasaa Malamal Sireesaadhu Sootu Kataai Kapaah Vounaavai.
translation: On the other hand, from cotton are made coarse cloth muslin and sirisaf.

gurmukhi: ਲਜਣੁ ਕਜਣੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਸਾਧੁ ਅਸਾਧੁ ਬਿਰਦੁ ਬਿਰਦਾਵੈ
transliteration: Lajanu Kajanu Hoi Kai Saadhu Asaadhu Biradu Biradaavai.
translation: Cotton in the form of cloth covers the modesty of others and protects the dharma of sadhus as well as wicked persons.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਗ ਦੋਖ ਨਿਰਦੋਖ ਮੋਖ ਸੰਗ ਸੁਭਾੳੁ ਨ ਸਾਧੁ ਮਿਟਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sang Dokh Niradokh Mokh Sang Soubhaau N Saadhu Mitaavai.
translation: The sadhus even when they associate with the evil never repudiate their saintly nature.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਪੜੁ ਹੋਵੈ ਧਰਮਸਾਲ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਪਗ ਧੂੜਿ ਧੁਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Traparhu Hovai Dharamasaal Saadhasangati Pag Dhoorhi Dhoumaavai.
translation: When the hemp transformed into coarse cloth is brought to the holy places for spreading in the holy congregation, it also becomes blest after coming in touch with the dust of the feet of the sadhus.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਟਿ ਕੁਟਿ ਸਣ ਕਿਰਤਾਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਜਸੁ ਲਿਖਿ ਪੁਰਾਣ ਸੁਨਾਵੈ
transliteration: Kati Kouti San Kirataasu Kari Hari Jasu Likhi Puraan Sounaavai.
translation: Also, when after getting a thorough beating paper is made of it, the holy men write praises of the Lord.on it and recite the same for others.

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿਤ ਪੁਨੀਤੁ ਕਰੈ ਜਨ ਭਾਵੈ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Patit Pouneet Karai Jan Bhaavai ?19?
translation: The holy congregation makes the fallen ones also  holy.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਸੰਗਤ ਗੁਣ
translation: virtues of the holy congregation

gurmukhi: ਪਥਰ ਚਿਤੁ ਕਠੋਰੁ ਹੈ ਚੂਨਾਂ ਹੋਵੈ ਅਗੀ ਦਧਾ
transliteration: Padar Chitu Katdoru Hai Choonaa Hovai Ageen Dadhaa.
translation: When the hard hearted stone is burnt, it turns into lime stone. sprinkling of  water extinguishes fire

gurmukhi: ਅਗ ਬੁਝੈ ਜਲੁ ਛਿੜਕਿਅੈ ਚੂਨਾ ਅਗਿ ੳੁਠੈ ਅਤਿ ਵਧਾ
transliteration: Ag Bujhai Jalu Chhirhakiai Choonaa Agi Outday Ati Vadhaa.
translation: But in the case of lime water produces great heat.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਪਾੲੇ ਵਿਹੁ ਨ ਜਾੲਿ ਅਗਨਿ ਨ ਛੁਟੈ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਬਧਾ
transliteration: Paanee Paaay Vihu N Jaai Agani N Chhoutai Avagoun Badhaa.
translation: Its poison does not go away even if water is thrown on it and its foul fire remains in it .

gurmukhi: ਜੀਭੈ ੳੁਤੈ ਰਖਿਅਾ ਛਾਲੇ ਪਵਨਿ ਸੰਗਿ ਦੁਖ ਲਧਾ
transliteration: Jeebhai Outai Rakhiaa Chhaalay Pavani Sangi Doukh Ladhaa.
translation: If put on tongue, it creates painful blisters.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਨ ਸੁਪਾਰੀ ਕਥੁ ਮਿਲਿ ਰੰਗੁ ਸੁਰੰਗੁ ਸੰਪੂਰਣੁ ਸਧਾ
transliteration: Paan Soupaaree Kadu Mili Rangu Surangu Sanpooranu Sadhaa.
translation: But getting company of betel leaf, betel nut and catechu its colour becomes bright, beautiful and completely refined.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਾਧੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਹਾ ਅਸਾਧ ਸਮਧਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Mili Saadhu Hoi Guramoukhi Mahaa Asaadh Samadhaa.
translation: Similarly joining the holy congregation becoming holy men, the gurmukhs get rid of even the chronic ailments.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਪਲੁ ਅਧਾ ॥੨੦॥੨੫॥
transliteration: Aapu Gavaai Milai Palu Adhaa ?20?25?panjheeha?
translation: When the ego is lost, God is visualized even in half a moment.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਅਧਮ ਅਸਾਧ ਸਾਧ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਜੰਤ ਸੰਤ ਨਾਮ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Adham Asaadh Saadha , Gurmati Sati Kari Jant Sant Naam Hai ?
translation: By adopting and accepting the Guru's word as true and immortal, a lowly and base person can become pious. By concentrating on the precepts of Guru, even a lowly and trivial person can rise to become a holy man.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਅਬਿਬੇਕੀ ਹੁੲਿ ਬਿਬੇਕੀ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਾਮ ਨਿਹਕਾਮ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Abibaykee Hui Bibaykee , Gurmati Sati Kari Kaam Nihakaam Hai ?
translation: The thoughtless and ignorant person becomes rational and considerate once he accepts the truth of Guru's wisdom. He also becomes free from all desires and wants.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਅਗਿਅਾਨੀ ਬ੍ਹਮਗਿਅਾਨੀ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਹਜ ਬਿਸ੍ਰਾਮ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Agiaanee Brahamagiaanee , Gurmati Sati Kari Sahaj Bisraam Hai ?
translation: One who is wandering in the darkness of ignorance becomes a Brahm Gyani once he accepts the truth of Guru's wisdom and teachings. By practicing the teachings of Guru with full devotion and confidence, one reaches a state of equipoise.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਭੲੇ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਧਾਮ ਹੈ ॥੨੫॥
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Jeevan Moukati Bhaay , Gurmati Sati Kari Nihachal Dhaam Hai ?25?
translation: By accepting Guru's teachings as true and practicing them with concentration, devotion and faith, one attains salvation when still alive and secures a place in the higher realms of the Lord. (25)
